findings.title: TOOL CHAINING ABUSE detected by YARA
findings.description: Detects suspicious tool chaining patterns that could lead to data exfiltration: GET, POST
findings.remediation: Review and remove tool chaining abuse pattern

findings.title: INJECTION ATTACK detected by YARA
findings.description: Detects command injection patterns in agent skills: shell operators, system commands, and network tools: curl http://localhost:8081/api/hello
findings.remediation: Review and remove injection attack pattern

findings.title: Missing Optional Metadata Fields
findings.description: The skill manifest is missing optional fields 'compatibility' and 'allowed-tools'. While these fields are not required by the agent skills specification, their absence reduces transparency about the skill's requirements and intended tool usage. This is informational only and does not represent a security threat.
findings.snippet:
compatibility: Not specified
allowed-tools: Not specified
findings.remediation: Consider adding 'compatibility' field to specify supported environments (e.g., 'Claude.ai, Claude Code, API') and 'allowed-tools' field to declare which agent tools this skill uses (e.g., [Read, Write] if it needs file access).

metadata.overall_assessment: SAFE - This skill provides documentation and guidelines for creating API routes in Expo Router with EAS Hosting. It contains only instructional markdown content with code examples for TypeScript/JavaScript development. No executable scripts (Python/Bash) are present. No security threats detected. The skill appears to be purely educational/reference material for developers working with Expo Router. The missing optional metadata fields and referenced files are minor documentation issues only.

findings.title: Referenced Files Not Found in Package
findings.description: The skill instructions reference two files (Client.py and services.py) that are not included in the skill package. While this appears to be documentation referencing example code patterns rather than actual dependencies, missing referenced files could indicate incomplete packaging or documentation inconsistencies. No evidence of malicious intent detected.
findings.snippet:
Files referenced in instructions: Client.py, services.py
**Referenced File: Client.py** (not found)
**Referenced File: services.py** (not found)
findings.remediation: Either include the referenced files in the skill package if they are required dependencies, or clarify in the documentation that these are example filenames for illustration purposes only.
